title: List of tallest buildings in San Diego
summary: San Diego has over 150 high-rises, mainly in the downtown district. In the city, there are 42 buildings that stand taller than 300 feet (91 m). In the 1970s, the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) began restricting downtown building height to maximum of 500 feet (152 m) within a 1.5-mile (2.4 km) radius of San Diego International Airport's single runway.[1][2][lower-alpha 1] The tallest building in the city is the 34-story One America Plaza, completed in 1991, which stands 500 feet (152 m) tall.[3]
